intro: Angolluma somalensis, commonly known as the Somali angolluma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often with deep roots to access groundwater.
